commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: I7dc431aea5d800f000826cb371c4f1e1c89dc302

commit_message:
Replace deprecated ugettext_lazy and ungettext_lazy

The ugettext_lazy method and the ungettext_lazy method are both
deprecated since Django 3.0[1].

These were already replaced in Horizon repo by [2].

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.0/releases/3.0/#id3
[2] cd7c1b5110fe1f64cd9dfbeb1072b37912d0efee

commit_message:
Fix malformed OIDCMemCacheServers

Change from comma separated list of memcache servers to space separated list.
Comma seperated list results in a 500 error response.
Upstream docs state this should be space separated and can be found here:
https://github.com/zmartzone/mod_auth_openidc/blob/master/auth_openidc.conf#L629-L631

Closes-Bug: #1972033
Change-Id: Ibaef3672c656213dd5ba1488379d686130e041c5
(cherry picked from commit 6563191de81457ec04eaa44e3d9a639c4dacbe76)

subject: iscsid: Replace hiera by lookup
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 9816, 'name': 'Takashi Kajinami', 'email': 'kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com', 'username': 'kajinamit'}, {'_account_id': 21129, 'name': 'Alan Bishop', 'email': 'abishop@redhat.com', 'username': 'ASBishop'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-23 10:09:48.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/iscsid.pp'], 'message': 'iscsid: Replace hiera by lookup

The hiera function is deprecated and does not work with the latest
hieradata version 5. It should be replaced by the new lookup
function[1].

[1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_automatic.html

With the lookup function, we can define value type and merge behavior,
but these are kept default at this moment to limit scope of this change
to just simple replacement. Adding value type might be useful to make
sure the value is in expected type (especially when a boolean value is
expected), but we will revisit that later.

example:
lookup(<NAME>, [<VALUE TYPE>], [<MERGE BEHAVIOR>], [<DEFAULT VALUE>])

Change-Id: I9d6befd2ec441cb8511f3d37980f7014ee4ad2ce
'}]
commit_message:
iscsid: Replace hiera by lookup

The hiera function is deprecated and does not work with the latest
hieradata version 5. It should be replaced by the new lookup
function[1].

[1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_automatic.html

With the lookup function, we can define value type and merge behavior,
but these are kept default at this moment to limit scope of this change
to just simple replacement. Adding value type might be useful to make
sure the value is in expected type (especially when a boolean value is
expected), but we will revisit that later.

example:
lookup(<NAME>, [<VALUE TYPE>], [<MERGE BEHAVIOR>], [<DEFAULT VALUE>])

Change-Id: I9d6befd2ec441cb8511f3d37980f7014ee4ad2ce

subject: Use goto, chain policy and drop REJECT
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-25 13:29:21.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/nodepool-base/install.d/20-iptables'], 'message': 'Use goto, chain policy and drop REJECT

The current way iptables chains are managed prevent any change in
tripleo itself, such as [1].

In order to allow a more evolutive management, it's better to actually
rely on the chain policy and use of the "goto" option.

This change introduces:
- "-g" instead of "-j"
- removal of the final REJECT rule in openstack-INPUT chain
- DROP policy for INPUT chain

First one will ensure the packet will go back to INPUT in case it
doesn't match anything in the openstack-INPUT chain
Second one will ensure rules being added after that goto will be taken
into account
Third one will mimic the current way of locking the INPUT.

Note this patch is the same as proposed in the system-config here:
https://review.opendev.org/c/opendev/system-config/+/839210

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/839163

Change-Id: If5cd2f5d082b5c9bdf40276ed94f5b5efc4c1444
Closes-Bug: #1970211
'}]
commit_message:
Use goto, chain policy and drop REJECT

The current way iptables chains are managed prevent any change in
tripleo itself, such as [1].

In order to allow a more evolutive management, it's better to actually
rely on the chain policy and use of the "goto" option.

This change introduces:
- "-g" instead of "-j"
- removal of the final REJECT rule in openstack-INPUT chain
- DROP policy for INPUT chain

First one will ensure the packet will go back to INPUT in case it
doesn't match anything in the openstack-INPUT chain
Second one will ensure rules being added after that goto will be taken
into account
Third one will mimic the current way of locking the INPUT.

Note this patch is the same as proposed in the system-config here:
https://review.opendev.org/c/opendev/system-config/+/839210

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/839163

Change-Id: If5cd2f5d082b5c9bdf40276ed94f5b5efc4c1444
Closes-Bug: #1970211

commit_message:
Bump minimum version of gnocchiclient for aggregats API support

The commit 74eadfbd58359b7ebe9e1e40ae6b6ff245146bb8 introduced usage
of aggregates API, which is available since gnocchiclient 6.0.0 .

This change bumps the minimum version to ensure the API is available.

Change-Id: I64a984fe64c8fe69856980df9e28a67f5eb29b58
(cherry picked from commit 6648f6b684a09efd5598e5a709223992bdebfa12)

commit_message:
Bump minimum version of gnocchiclient for aggregats API support

The commit 74eadfbd58359b7ebe9e1e40ae6b6ff245146bb8 introduced usage
of aggregates API, which is available since gnocchiclient 6.0.0 .

This change bumps the minimum version to ensure the API is available.

Change-Id: I64a984fe64c8fe69856980df9e28a67f5eb29b58
(cherry picked from commit 6648f6b684a09efd5598e5a709223992bdebfa12)

subject: Suppress Warnings for SQL Alchemy IN operator
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-23 01:04:40.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/objects/vnf_package.py'], 'message': 'Suppress Warnings for SQL Alchemy IN operator

The `in_` operator of SQL Alchemy emits a warning when it coerces a
Subquery object into a select() implicitly [1].

This patch suppresses the warnings by explicitly coercing a Subquery
object to select() as shown in [2].

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/commit/3d99ee28ed368c3bdbeaf872ef65b0c9a7c0da33
[2] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/blob/605d0d905855684bfe4409532af98f336ae38f82/test/sql/test_operators.py#L3295-L3319

Closes-Bug: #1967700
Change-Id: I90729463613e8d4768e0e466b9636967ccfa48e7
'}]
commit_message:
Suppress Warnings for SQL Alchemy IN operator

The `in_` operator of SQL Alchemy emits a warning when it coerces a
Subquery object into a select() implicitly [1].

This patch suppresses the warnings by explicitly coercing a Subquery
object to select() as shown in [2].

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/commit/3d99ee28ed368c3bdbeaf872ef65b0c9a7c0da33
[2] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/blob/605d0d905855684bfe4409532af98f336ae38f82/test/sql/test_operators.py#L3295-L3319

Closes-Bug: #1967700
Change-Id: I90729463613e8d4768e0e466b9636967ccfa48e7

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-05-06 02:54:45.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I97ed4117e009f75c4670aa78b0d50db59dcb7da8
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I97ed4117e009f75c4670aa78b0d50db59dcb7da8

subject: Set False to include_empty_option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-04-15 03:04:09.000000000', 'files': ['heat_dashboard/content/stacks/forms.py'], 'message': "Set False to include_empty_option

In _populate_custom_choices(), all methods called at the method have
True as a second argument. It means that the default values sepcified
in a stack are not shown as default when launch stack form.
The fileds always show 'Select Flavor/Image/Network'.
Users doesn't expect to choose default value by hand.
This change shows the default values defined at a template.

Also, image_field_data() doesn't use parameter, include_empty_option.
This change modfies the method to change the behavior based on the
parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1619465
Change-Id: I4b6bef322a668a805abcd4bc472d30f6d1df3a0a
"}]
commit_message:
Set False to include_empty_option

In _populate_custom_choices(), all methods called at the method have
True as a second argument. It means that the default values sepcified
in a stack are not shown as default when launch stack form.
The fileds always show 'Select Flavor/Image/Network'.
Users doesn't expect to choose default value by hand.
This change shows the default values defined at a template.

Also, image_field_data() doesn't use parameter, include_empty_option.
This change modfies the method to change the behavior based on the
parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1619465
Change-Id: I4b6bef322a668a805abcd4bc472d30f6d1df3a0a

commit_message:
Replace deprecated django.conf.urls.url()

This method is deprecated in Django 3.1[1], in favor of
django.urls.re_path(), and triggers the following warning.

RemovedInDjango40Warning: django.conf.urls.url() is deprecated in favor
of django.urls.re_path().

This was already fixed in Horizon by [2].

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/4.0/releases/3.1/#id2
[2] d9266fd82c1f0acc6b7236a6dc9b7e510985eb13

Change-Id: Ib921e98f220efb697e42673ca43da36cc151e7c7

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-12 14:11:27.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_cephadm/templates/deployed_ceph.yaml.j2', 'tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_cephadm/tasks/pools.yaml', 'tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_cephadm/tasks/export.yaml', 'tripleo_ansible/playbooks/cli-deployed-ceph.yaml'], 'message': "Create Ceph pools/cephx keys with cli-deployed-ceph.yaml

If the tripleo_cephadm_pools and tripleo_cephadm_keys
parameters are defined, then call the tripleo_cephadm
role's pools, keys, and export tasks.

If the tripleo_cephadm_pools were created, then ensure
it's values are exported under CephPools in the deployed
Ceph file. Do the same for tripleo_ceph_client_vars,
ceph_client_key, and ceph_client_username. These last
two values are only used by TripleO Heat Templates so
they have no defaults in the the tripleo_cephadm role.

(cherry picked from commit 210447990474940923e1be58e726ccf5bb0b27b3)
"}]
commit_message:
Create Ceph pools/cephx keys with cli-deployed-ceph.yaml

If the tripleo_cephadm_pools and tripleo_cephadm_keys
parameters are defined, then call the tripleo_cephadm
role's pools, keys, and export tasks.

If the tripleo_cephadm_pools were created, then ensure
it's values are exported under CephPools in the deployed
Ceph file. Do the same for tripleo_ceph_client_vars,
ceph_client_key, and ceph_client_username. These last
two values are only used by TripleO Heat Templates so
they have no defaults in the the tripleo_cephadm role.
They're only optionally passed through as --extra-vars
by python-tripleoclient.

Also, handle when tripleo_enabled_services is undefined
and ensure tripleo_ceph_client_vars path exists before
creating the file.

Conflicts:
tripleo_ansible/playbooks/cli-deployed-ceph.yaml
roles/tripleo_cephadm/templates/deployed_ceph.yaml.j2

Includes Ic52ee6091ebab6f937a4a15c83a28f0b3918d374
so that this backport does not introduce a bug.

Change-Id: Ib87a8a5a550676b32302c0cc9c447f8b9fe3a149
(cherry picked from commit 210447990474940923e1be58e726ccf5bb0b27b3)

subject: Trainl-only: Fix broken healthcheck of zaqar websocket endpoint
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-23 15:33:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': 'Trainl-only: Fix broken healthcheck of zaqar websocket endpoint

This partially reverts 6af63e1bb13e79d8e7a0f9c12986b24b3e64ff68 and
removes the healthcheck options added to the zaqar websocket endpoint.
The endpoint does not support the OPTIONS verb used by the httpchk.

Because websocket service behaves differently from usual REST servers,
this also removes httplog.

This fix is directly submitted to stable/train because the options
parameter were updated only in stable/train. (Because Zaqar was removed
in stable/wallaby and we "missed" updating the endpoint in
stale/victoria fortunately)

Closes-Bug: #1975462
Change-Id: I48330f0a6b79f25dcc25c59d33c90fa62407c635
'}]
commit_message:
Trainl-only: Fix broken healthcheck of zaqar websocket endpoint

This partially reverts 6af63e1bb13e79d8e7a0f9c12986b24b3e64ff68 and
removes the healthcheck options added to the zaqar websocket endpoint.
The endpoint does not support the OPTIONS verb used by the httpchk.

Because websocket service behaves differently from usual REST servers,
this also removes httplog.

This fix is directly submitted to stable/train because the options
parameter were updated only in stable/train. (Because Zaqar was removed
in stable/wallaby and we "missed" updating the endpoint in
stale/victoria fortunately)

Closes-Bug: #1975462
Change-Id: I48330f0a6b79f25dcc25c59d33c90fa62407c635

subject: neutron: Avoid hard-coding defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-23 00:02:21.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_network_neutron_spec.rb', 'manifests/network/neutron.pp'], 'message': 'neutron: Avoid hard-coding defaults

This change replaces redundant defaults in nova::neutron, which define
the exact same values as service defaults, by $::os_service_default, to
reduce effort to maintain the implementations to keep them consistent
with any update in nova itself.

Change-Id: Ia01c936611a846399f19b1b0425e5ab4ff18a9e1
'}]
commit_message:
neutron: Avoid hard-coding defaults

This change replaces redundant defaults in nova::neutron, which define
the exact same values as service defaults, by $::os_service_default, to
reduce effort to maintain the implementations to keep them consistent
with any update in nova itself.

Change-Id: Ia01c936611a846399f19b1b0425e5ab4ff18a9e1

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-16 22:34:26.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/templates/dnsmasq.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Switch grub network boot from TFTP to HTTP

Change-Id: I2ab07cea63948020d19d0485b6e8485e48656ac0
'}]
commit_message:
Switch grub network boot from TFTP to HTTP

This is preferable assuming the http module is commonly included in
grub binaries.

Change-Id: I2ab07cea63948020d19d0485b6e8485e48656ac0

subject: Restart rpc services once to test service cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2022-05-23 17:46:15.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/senlin', 'devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Restart rpc services once to test service cleanup

Add a step to restart all rpc services at startup
to ensure that our service clean up steps are not failing.

Change-Id: I9c7569ace63d823971ad6e3289cf4a40f09a25f6
'}]
commit_message:
Restart rpc services once to test service cleanup

Add a step to restart all rpc services at startup
to ensure that our service clean up steps are not failing.

Change-Id: I9c7569ace63d823971ad6e3289cf4a40f09a25f6

subject: Improve quota API validations
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-17 22:08:51.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/__init__.py', 'designate/common/constants.py', 'designate/tests/test_quota/test_storage.py', 'designate/tests/unit/objects/test_quota.py', 'designate/objects/quota.py'], 'message': 'Improve quota API validations

This patch improves the quotas API validations and test coverage. Invalid quota settings will now be caught at the API/Central layer and not down in the storage layer(DB).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin/+/842238
Closes-Bug: #1934596
Change-Id: I474bdd988a6cc3a9bcce1b65c2f49216dd85addf
'}]
commit_message:
Improve quota API validations

This patch improves the quotas API validations and test coverage. Invalid quota settings will now be caught at the API/Central layer and not down in the storage layer(DB).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin/+/842238
Closes-Bug: #1934596
Change-Id: I474bdd988a6cc3a9bcce1b65c2f49216dd85addf

subject: Added lifecycle management isolation testing to openstack umbrella chart(currently 6 subcharts) and other non-umbrella charts(which will be merged into umbrella chart)
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2022-05-23 04:44:52.000000000', 'files': ['tools/deployment/developer/lcm-isolation-testing/test.yml', 'tools/deployment/developer/lcm-isolation-testing/lcm-isolation-test.sh', 'zuul.d/jobs-openstack-helm.yaml'], 'message': 'Added lifecycle management isolation testing to openstack umbrella
chart(currently 6 subcharts) and other non-umbrella charts(which will be
merged into umbrella chart)

	Gate scripts to test the changes submitted to openstack helm charts. These scripts will upgrade each chart  and ensure that this upgrade is not effecting o        ther charts.

Change-Id: Ibc6aea15fb8a6086a99f744ae9169cedb295bf9e
'}]
commit_message:
Added lifecycle management isolation testing to openstack umbrella
chart(currently 6 subcharts) and other non-umbrella charts(which will be
merged into umbrella chart)

	Gate scripts to test the changes submitted to openstack helm charts. These scripts will upgrade each chart  and ensure that this upgrade is not effecting o        ther charts.

Change-Id: Ibc6aea15fb8a6086a99f744ae9169cedb295bf9e

subject: Use full URL to call external NFVO
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25701, 'name': 'Yasufumi Ogawa', 'email': 'yasufum.o@gmail.com', 'username': 'yasufum'}, {'_account_id': 31072, 'name': 'Hiroo Kitamura', 'email': 'hiroo.kitamura@ntt-at.co.jp', 'username': 'Hiroo.Kitamura'}, {'_account_id': 31668, 'name': 'Ai Hamano', 'email': 'ai.hamano@ntt-at.co.jp', 'username': 'hamano'}, {'_account_id': 31857, 'name': 'Ayumu Ueha', 'email': 'ueha.ayumu@fujitsu.com', 'username': 'ueha'}, {'_account_id': 32102, 'name': 'Manpreet Kaur', 'email': 'kaurmanpreet2620@gmail.com', 'username': 'manpreet'}, {'_account_id': 32581, 'name': 'Hirofumi Noguchi', 'email': 'hirofumi.noguchi.rs@hco.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'hirofumi-noguchi'}, {'_account_id': 34226, 'name': 'Ken Fujimoto', 'email': 'fujimoto@valinux.co.jp', 'username': 'k-fujimoto'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2022-04-27 05:13:35.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/sol_refactored/nfvo/nfvo_client.py'], 'message': "Use full URL to call external NFVO

Common http utilities used by v2 API use keystoneauth1 module.
If a server is a service in OpenStack, clients can omit endpoint.
But if a server is a service outside of OpenStack, clients can't
omit endpoint.
This patch fixes to add endpoint to URL in case that a server is
an external NFVO.

Change-Id: I3cf8b608d2996a47f798184ae4006282f672dd02
"}]
commit_message:
Use full URL to call external NFVO

Common http utilities used by v2 API use keystoneauth1 module.
If a server is a service in OpenStack, clients can omit endpoint.
But if a server is a service outside of OpenStack, clients can't
omit endpoint.
This patch fixes to add endpoint to URL in case that a server is
an external NFVO.

Change-Id: I3cf8b608d2996a47f798184ae4006282f672dd02

commit_message:
Replace wait_for with wait_for_connection

The "Wait for provisioned nodes to boot" tasks in cli playbooks
should use the wait_for_connection plugin instead of the wait_for
plugin.

ansible.builtin.wait_for_connection
 : Waits until remote system is reachable/usable

Change-Id: Ib53852ed235a0965f9bf2be7c957f7fca141462d
(cherry picked from commit b4e23529891eccd83e1e313e871e299b16ed93e7
                and commit ba4e9908acd2931c693f45cda8b4a26748a3b846)

commit_message:
Use centos amphora image in the FIPS jobs

The FIPS jobs use centos-8-stream controllers but the image is still
based on ubuntu, this commit updates the amphora images to
centos-8-stream and enable FIPS inside the amphora.

Change-Id: I8916796ed6727a103907a33d3c14e99e1d3734e6
(cherry picked from commit 74a7cbe122c4bb2d826cfb2b9c0e1657df9aedec)

subject: [stable-only] Use Tempest's run upper constraints from devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2022-05-23 07:35:02.000000000', 'files': ['gate/live_migration/hooks/utils.sh'], 'message': "[stable-only] Use Tempest's run upper constraints from devstack

Devstack creates the tempest virtual env with upper
constraints set by TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS[1].
For stable/train, they are stable/train constraints but then nova
run tempest in run_tests.sh then it does not set/pass the
upper constraints so master constraints is used and it ends up
recreating the tempest virtual env and fail the job.

We should make sure that upper constraints used in nova tempest run
and devstack is same.

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f50f83571d4348e996e175ea5aad97f7/log/job-output.txt#5100

[1] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/stable/train/stackrc#L320

Change-Id: Iad2d198c58512b26dc2733b97bedeffc00108656
"}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Use Tempest's run upper constraints from devstack

Devstack creates the tempest virtual env with upper
constraints set by TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS[1].
For stable/train, they are stable/train constraints but then nova
run tempest in run_tests.sh then it does not set/pass the
upper constraints so master constraints is used and it ends up
recreating the tempest virtual env and fail the job.

We should make sure that upper constraints used in nova tempest run
and devstack is same.

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f50f83571d4348e996e175ea5aad97f7/log/job-output.txt#5100

[1] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/stable/train/stackrc#L320

Change-Id: Iad2d198c58512b26dc2733b97bedeffc00108656

commit_message:
Make ``MechDriverSetupBase`` abstract

The class ``MechDriverSetupBase`` is a base class for other testing
classes. Make it explicitly an abstract class although that won't
prevent from instantiating an object of this class.

Trivial-Fix

Change-Id: I0236f5ede20cd1cbc44a5a79013eab12a7843389

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-23 12:51:57.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-cellv2/tasks/add_internalapi_hosts_entries.yml'], 'message': "Add cell internalapi VIP in controllers /etc/hosts

When adding a cell into a tls-everywhere environment, also the
cellcontroller(s) internal api vip(s) is/are required to be added to
the central overcloud controllers, because when using a tls-everywhere
environment nova uses the cell controller internal api hostname instead
of the vip to connect to the cell DB.

When user executes the create-nova-cell-v2 playbook, as documented in
[0], add such extra entry/entries into the central controllers

"}]
commit_message:
Add cell internalapi VIP in controllers /etc/hosts

When adding a cell into a tls-everywhere environment, also the
cellcontroller(s) internal api vip(s) is/are required to be added to
the central overcloud controllers, because when using a tls-everywhere
environment nova uses the cell controller internal api hostname instead
of the vip to connect to the cell DB.

When user executes the create-nova-cell-v2 playbook, as documented in
[0], add such extra entry/entries into the central controllers
/etc/hosts. Only do that if internal_api_vip and internal_api_hostname
are defined in the cell controller(s)' group hostvars (that would match
both non/TLS-E cases automagically).

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/features/deploy_cellv2_basic.html#cell-create-cell

Related: rhbz#1926716

Change-Id: Ib23d06ea702545a0c2f4f47da63ce588957488fe
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c52f115d51174c450bb7503d3285ec4c6a67411c)

commit_message:
Add cell internalapi VIP in controllers /etc/hosts

When adding a cell into a tls-everywhere environment, also the
cellcontroller(s) internal api vip(s) is/are required to be added to
the central overcloud controllers, because when using a tls-everywhere
environment nova uses the cell controller internal api hostname instead
of the vip to connect to the cell DB.

When user executes the create-nova-cell-v2 playbook, as documented in
[0], add such extra entry/entries into the central controllers
/etc/hosts. Only do that if internal_api_vip and internal_api_hostname
are defined in the cell controller(s)' group hostvars (that would match
both non/TLS-E cases automagically).

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/features/deploy_cellv2_basic.html#cell-create-cell

Related: rhbz#1926716

Change-Id: Ib23d06ea702545a0c2f4f47da63ce588957488fe
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c52f115d51174c450bb7503d3285ec4c6a67411c)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-03-08 11:35:08.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I61d4dfc60509e0b7a86251ae9e7f01a107a730c3
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I61d4dfc60509e0b7a86251ae9e7f01a107a730c3

commit_message:
Do not use custom_member_list for glance,tacker

1. Glance and tacker

As glance and tacker are using default haproxy
configuration from haproxy-config role, there is
no need to define custom_member_list in their defaults.

This patch is proposed mainly because without it
[1] is not working for these two services.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/775627

2. Refactor variable names to avoid conflicts from user
   overwrites.

Change-Id: Ib7d6e50b7214bf0106afac1cf0aa4a60e5ab7512

subject: Rename molecule jobs to centos-stream
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2022-05-23 05:38:17.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/molecule.yaml', 'tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_metrics_qdr/molecule/controller-mesh-edge-node/molecule.yml', 'tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/tests/molecule/tripleo_container_configs/molecule.yml', 'tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/tests/molecule/tripleo_dnf_stream/molecule.yml', 'zuul.d/base.yaml'], 'message': 'Rename molecule jobs to centos-stream

https://review.opendev.org/839688 ports the job from
centos-stream 8 to 9, but the patch size is getting
bigger and job failures are also high.

In order to avoid updating the job definitions each time a
new centos stream release comes, it renames the job
definitions.

It also includes:
- Put the platform mol config under tripleo_dnf_stream
- Add cleanup step in tripleo_container_configs to cleanup the artifacts
- Making molecule-tripleo_metrics_qdr job non-voting till
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1973874 gets fixed.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I21dd3741b54ed434e16d89db03e4e37ea093eabb
'}]
commit_message:
Rename molecule jobs to centos-stream

https://review.opendev.org/839688 ports the job from
centos-stream 8 to 9, but the patch size is getting
bigger and job failures are also high.

In order to avoid updating the job definitions each time a
new centos stream release comes, it renames the job
definitions.

It also includes:
- Put the platform mol config under tripleo_dnf_stream
- Add cleanup step in tripleo_container_configs to cleanup the artifacts
- Making molecule-tripleo_metrics_qdr job non-voting till
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1973874 gets fixed.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I21dd3741b54ed434e16d89db03e4e37ea093eabb

commit_message:
db: Remove MongoDB backend support

Support for MongoDB backend was used by puppet-ceilometer but it is
no longer used since MongoDB was replaced by Gnocchi.

Because we no longer expect any real use case, this change removes
the implementation directly with deprecation skipped.

Change-Id: I5203cefe77c6c1410842fa7c530f98761fe65ed4

subject: Remove handling of 'u' prefix
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-18 01:48:26.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/neutron.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_port/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_subnet/openstack.rb'], 'message': "Remove handling of 'u' prefix

... because the prefix is no longer printed in Python 3.

In python 2
>>> print({u'foo': u'baa'})
{u'foo': u'baa'}
>>> print([u'foo', 'baa'])
[u'foo', 'baa']

In python 3
>>> print({u'foo': u'baa'})
{'foo': 'baa'}
>>> print([u'foo', 'baa'])
['foo', 'baa']

Change-Id: I8dc8f83b3be836f201b1df4bfaaa781a77d08557
"}]
commit_message:
Remove handling of 'u' prefix

... because the prefix is no longer printed in Python 3.

In python 2
>>> print({u'foo': u'baa'})
{u'foo': u'baa'}
>>> print([u'foo', 'baa'])
[u'foo', 'baa']

In python 3
>>> print({u'foo': u'baa'})
{'foo': 'baa'}
>>> print([u'foo', 'baa'])
['foo', 'baa']

Change-Id: I8dc8f83b3be836f201b1df4bfaaa781a77d08557

commit_message:
Remove novajoin support

The novajoin[1] project has been unmaintained for last two years.
We deprecated support for the service during the previous cycle[2],
and no longer expect any user requires it.

[1] https://opendev.org/x/novajoin
[2] 70bb80f6d33a4c81a370cd051a4a47c5a2b2c88c

Change-Id: I8f21036de12d78ca25fddaf02399e4c38b490ed5

commit_message:
Introduced helm hooks for senlin jobs

Chart upgrade fails when there is changes in config as jobs fields are immutable. Having hooks in jobs forces them to be recreated at every upgrade which will solve the immutable fields error in jobs

Change-Id: I05c91fb59355789a2de4295c69b18d01761996e7
